{{BLP sources|date=July 2016}} {{Infobox military person |name= Air Chief Marshal Abu Esrar,BBP,NDC,ACSC |birth_date= 1961 |death_date= |birth_place= [[Gazipur]], [[Bangladesh]] |death_place= |placeofburial= |placeofburial_label= Place of burial |image=File:Avm_esrar_bangladesh.jpg |width= |caption=Abu Esrar as Air Vice Marshal |nickname= |allegiance= [[Bangladesh]] |branch=[[Bangladesh Air Force]] |serviceyears=1 February, 1981 - present |rank=[[File:UK-Air-OF9.svg|20px]] [[Air Chief Marshal]]
[[File:Air Chief Marshal star plate.svg|20px]] |commands=25 Squadron (Chittagong)
35 Squadron (Chittagong)
Air Officer Commanding, Paharkanchanpur base(Tangail)
Air Officer Commanding, Bashar base(Dhaka)
Air Officer Commanding, Zahurul Huq base(Chittagong)
Assistant Chief of Air Staff (Operations & Training)
Chief of Air Staff |unit= |battles= |awards= |religion= [[Islam]] |laterwork= }} Air Chief Marshal '''Abu Esrar''',BBP,NDC,ACSC is the current and 14th [[Chief of Air Staff (Bangladesh)|Chief of the Air Staff]] of the [[Bangladesh Air Force]]. He took over as the chief on 12 June 2015 from Air Marshal Enamul Bari. He is the first four-star [[air officer]] (Air Chief Marshal) of [[Bangladesh]]. He was promoted to [[Air Chief Marshal|ACM]] on 16 January 2016. ==Birth== Esrar was born in 1961 in [[Gazipur]] to Ayub and Akhtarunnesa. ==Air Force career== Esrar joined the [[Bangladesh Air Force]] on 19 September 1978. He was commissioned in the GD(P) branch in 1 February 1981. He has worked in most of the squadrons of BAF. He has flown PT-6, AA-SA, Fugi-200, MiG-29. He has also worked as instructor of new pilots. He has worked as Defense Attache in [[Moscow]], [[Russia]]. Before becoming air chief he was Assistant Chief of Air Staff (Operations and Training). Abu Esrar has undergone many courses in Bangladesh and abroad. He has completed 'Flying Instructors Course' in the [[United Kingdom]] and 'Flying Supervisors Course' in Australia. He has undergone training of A5IIIA and MiG-29 in [[China]] and [[Russia]] respectively. He got the prestigious 'Biman Bahini Padak' (BBP) in 2013. He has graduated from [[Air Command and Staff College]] (ACSC), USA and also he is a alumnus of Dhaka's 'National Defence College' (NDC). ==Personal life== The Air Chief Marshal is a widely travelled person and takes keen interest in painting, music and reading professional journals. In 1986, he married Mrs Tasneem Esrar – the only daughter of late Group Captain M.A. Rashid and Mrs Razia Rashid. The couple is blessed with three daughters. Away from work, the Air Chief Marshal enjoys practicing his skills in painting and loves to pass leisure with his kids{{cite web|url=http://newagebd.net/128865/baf-chief-takes-office/ |title=BAF chief takes office - New Age | New Age |website=Newagebd.net |date=2015-06-13 |accessdate=2016-07-19}}{{cite web|url=http://www.bssnews.net/newsDetails.php?cat=0&id=498634$date=2015-06-12&dateCurrent=2015-06-13 |title=News Details |website=Bssnews.net |date= |accessdate=2016-07-19}}{{cite web|url=http://bdnews24.com/bangladesh/2015/06/12/new-air-force-chief-abu-esrar-gets-rank-of-air-marshal |title=New Air Force chief Abu Esrar gets rank of Air Marshal |website=Bdnews24.com |date=2015-06-12 |accessdate=2016-07-19}}{{cite news|url=http://www.dhakatribune.com/bangladesh/2015/jun/05/abu-esrar-appointed-new-baf-chief |title=Abu Esrar appointed as new BAF Chief |newspaper=[[Dhaka Tribune]] |date=2015-06-05 |accessdate=2016-07-19}}{{cite web|url=http://www.daily-sun.com/printversion/details/107524/Navy-BAF-chiefs%E2%80%99-rank-upgraded |title=Navy, BAF chiefs’ rank upgraded |website=Daily-sun.com |date=2016-01-17 |accessdate=2016-07-19}}{{cite web|url=http://bdnews24.com/bangladesh/2016/06/22/prime-minister-hosts-iftar-party-for-dignitaries-at-ganabhaban |title=Prime minister hosts Iftar party for dignitaries at Ganabhaban |website=Bdnews24.com |date=2016-06-22 |accessdate=2016-07-19}} ==References== {{Reflist}} {{S-start}} {{S-mil}} {{S-bef | before = Air Marshal [[Enamul Bari]] }} {{S-ttl | title = [[Chief of Air Staff (Bangladesh)|Chief of the Air Staff of Bangladesh]] | years = 12 June 2015 – Present }} {{S-inc}} {{s-end}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Esrar, Abu}} [[Category:Bangladesh Air Force air marshals]] [[Category:1961 births]] [[Category:Living people]]
